quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: The most dangerous phrase in the English language is 'We've always done it this way'.
author: Grace Hopper

quote: There are only two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The three great virtues of a programmer: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Larry Wall

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Write tests until fear is transformed into boredom.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The computing scientist’s main challenge is not to get confused by the complexities of his own making.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: An algorithm must be seen to be believed.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: The task of the software development team is to engineer the illusion of simplicity.
author: Grady Booch

quote: In God we trust, all others must bring data.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: If you can't describe what you are doing as a process, you don't know what you're doing.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Much of the essence of building a program is in fact the debugging of the specification.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard E. Pattis

quote: In programming the hard part isn’t solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Prolific programmers contribute to certain disaster.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: Software gets slower faster than hardware gets faster.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software is not great.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren’t there.
author: Gordon Bell

quote: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: A picture may be worth a thousand words; a formula is worth a thousand pictures.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible.
author: Alan Kay

quote: The greatest performance improvement of all is when a system goes from not-working to working.
author: John Ousterhout

quote: A program that produces incorrect results twice as fast is infinitely slower.
author: John Ousterhout

quote: Fancy algorithms are slow when n is small, and n is usually small.
author: Robert Pike

quote: What is simplicity? Simplicity is the shortest path to a solution.
author: Ward Cunningham

quote: Cunningham's Law: The best way to get the right answer on the Internet is not to ask a question, it's to post the wrong answer.
author: Ward Cunningham

quote: Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
author: Douglas Hofstadter

quote: Linus’s Law: Given enough eyeballs, all bugs are shallow.
author: Eric S. Raymond

quote: Zawinski's Law: Every program attempts to expand until it can read mail. Those programs which cannot so expand are replaced by ones which can.
author: Jamie Zawinski

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming; feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: There are only two kinds of programming languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: Computer languages differ not so much in what they make possible, but in what they make easy.
author: Larry Wall

quote: There's only one trick in software, and that is using a piece of software that's already been written.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The manager's function is not to make people work, but to make it possible for people to work.
author: Tom DeMarco

quote: Conway's Law: Any organization that designs a system will produce a design whose structure is a copy of the organization's communication structure.
author: Melvin Conway

quote: Gall's Law: A complex system that works is invariably found to have evolved from a simple system that worked.
author: John Gall

quote: Atwood's Law: Any application that can be written in JavaScript, will eventually be written in JavaScript.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Simple rules guide innovative, intelligent responses. Comprehensive rules guide rote, routine responses.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: When project leaders focus on delivery, they add value to projects. When they focus on planning and control, they tend to add overhead.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: The formula for success is simple: deliver today, adapt tomorrow.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: Twelve distinct ways of representing data at the logical level are eleven too many.
author: Edgar F. Codd

quote: The way to get to the top of the heap in terms of developing original research is to be a fool, because only fools keep trying.
author: Martin Hellman
